article.title: Low-resolution near-infrared spectroscopic signatures of unresolved ultracool companions to M dwarfs

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the symbol size in Figure 1 (Left) represent?
choices: Spectral type of the UCD companion

multiple_choice_question.text: Which technique/facility shown in Figure 1 (Right) is expected to be most sensitive to detecting UCD companions at separations of ~10 AU around M dwarfs?
What is the significance of the stars plotted outside the dashed lines in Figure 2?
choices: Their photometric spectral types are significantly different from their spectroscopic values.
They have strong evidence for circumstellar disks.
They are highly variable M dwarfs.
The spectral ratio of a single object.
The difference in spectral morphology between a target and its control star.
The absolute flux difference between a target and its control star.
The significance of a detected UCD companion.
